triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a Monte-Carlo simulation algorithm as the core technique for real-time policy improvement.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper contributes policy improvement methodology within the reinforcement learning framework.

triples.name: Backgammon
triples.relevance: Backgammon is the primary application domain for demonstrating the effectiveness of the Monte-Carlo algorithm.

triples.name: TD-Gammon
triples.relevance: TD-Gammon is a strong baseline neural network model used as an initial policy for comparison and improvement.

triples.name: Neural network
triples.relevance: The paper applies Monte-Carlo search to improve policies based on multi-layer neural networks like TD-Gammon.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper frames policy improvement as an adaptive control problem where the controller adapts to improve performance.

triples.name: Expected value
triples.relevance: The algorithm measures the long-term expected reward of actions, a fundamental concept in reinforcement learning.

triples.name: IBM Scalable POWERparallel
triples.relevance: The algorithm was implemented on IBM SP1 and SP2 parallel supercomputers for efficient computation.
